movie_title: The final - who's going to win? The London to Edinburgh Challenge: Episode 10
introduction: What a race! The challenge is coming to an end, but don't be sad - learn some past tense verbs inste

vocabulary.example: I'm so excited to see the results of the competition.

vocabulary.definition: causing or likely to cause horror; shocking.
vocabulary.example: Working on the farm was horrible, I never want to do it again.

vocabulary.definition: needing much effort or skill to accomplish, deal with, or understand.
vocabulary.example: The challenge was difficult, but I managed to overcome it.

vocabulary.definition: causing great surprise or wonder; astonishing.
vocabulary.example: The view from the top of the mountain was absolutely amazing.

vocabulary.definition: having or showing keen interest or intense desire.
vocabulary.example: She was eager to start her new job and make a good impression.

vocabulary.definition: expressing good wishes when parting or ending a conversation.
vocabulary.example: After a successful presentation, they raised their glasses and said 'cheers' to celebrate.
